name: Navya Vohra
objective: Honors Bachelor's graduate in Computer Science with strong problem-solving and quick learning skills.
Results-oriented Developer, proven ability to design, develop, and test user-centric applications across mobile (iOS, Android) and web platforms.
Skilled in various programming languages (Swift, Kotlin, HTML, CSS, JavaScript) to deliver high-quality solutions.

responsibilities: Provided Consulting services to enhance the effectiveness of a Swift development program for high school students, resulting in a 25% increase in applications from students interested in joining the program.
Guided students through the entire iOS app development process, offering expert advice and support, resulting in a 90% success rate in presenting completed apps.
Developed user-friendly app updates for the TD Mobile App Android and iOS using Kotlin and Swift, driving improved user satisfaction and enhanced usability.
Led rigorous testing initiatives (accessibility focus) to boost app interactivity by 71%, ensuring a seamless user experience.
Implemented Agile methodologies for on-time delivery and maintained superior app quality through meticulous debugging.
Reduced post-release bugs by 20% through comprehensive testing (UI/Unit/Performance etc.) leveraging Selenium.
Optimized testing efficiency by 50% by implementing a mix of manual and automated testing, achieving increased coverage.
Ensured clear communication by effectively translating complex technical issues for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Leveraged AEM (Adobe Experience Manager) to develop interactive front-end components using HTML, JS, CSS and JavaScript for pharma clients and a non-profit, boosting engagement by 40%.
Contributed to a website for a non-profit (EAT REAL), projected to increase fundraising to $16M in the next five years.

awards_and_achievements: Participated in Hackathon (2022, 2023) and Leadership Conference (2020 - 2024)
Member of Google Developer Group and Women Tech Makers.
Member of Mobile Computing Club at Sheridan College.
Participated in Women in Tech Organization at BMO.
